titocc.compiler.elements

Class VariableDeclaration

  • java.lang.Object
    • titocc.compiler.elements.CodeElement
      • titocc.compiler.elements.Declaration
        • titocc.compiler.elements.VariableDeclaration
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Symbol

    public class VariableDeclaration
extends Declaration
implements Symbol
    Declares and defines global or local variable. Consists of a type, a name and an optional initializer expression. For global variables the initializer must be a compile time constant expression (thanks to C standard).

    EBNF definition:
    VARIABLE_DECLARATION = TYPE_SPECIFIER DECLARATOR ["=" EXPRESSION] ";"

      • VariableDeclaration

        public VariableDeclaration(TypeSpecifier typeSpecifier,
                   Declarator declarator,
                   Expression initializer,
                   int line,
                   int column)
        Constructs a VariableDeclaration.
        Parameters:
        typeSpecifier - specifier of the variable
        declarator - declarator of the variable
        initializer - initializer expression or null if the variable is left uninitialized
        line - starting line number of the variable declaration
        column - starting column/character of the variable declaration

           Scope scope,
           Registers regs)
             throws SyntaxException,
                    java.io.IOException
        Description copied from class: Declaration
        Generates assembly code for the declaration.
        Specified by:
        compile in class Declaration
        Parameters:
        asm - assembler used for code generation
        scope - scope in which the declaration is evaluated
        regs - available registers; must have at least one active register
        Throws:
        SyntaxException - if the declaration contains an error
        java.io.IOException - if assembler throws

      • getGlobalName

        public java.lang.String getGlobalName()
        Description copied from interface: Symbol
        Returns a globally unique name for the symbol. This is the name used in the ttk-91 code, accounting for the fact that there is only one namespace and names are case insensitive.
        Specified by:
        getGlobalName in interface Symbol
        Returns:
        the globally unique name

      • getReference

        public java.lang.String getReference()
        Description copied from interface: Symbol
        Returns the assembly code reference to this symbol. Can be used as the right side operand in most instructions. E.g. for global variables and functions it's the same as global name and for stack frame variables it is suffixed with "(fp)".
        Specified by:
        getReference in interface Symbol
        Returns:
        assembly code reference

        Returns:
        the string representation

      • parse

        public static VariableDeclaration parse(TokenStream tokens)
        Attempts to parse a variable declaration from token stream. If parsing fails the stream is reset to its initial position.
        Parameters:
        tokens - source token stream
        Returns:
        VariableDeclaration object or null if tokens don't form a valid variable declaration
